sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: US Undiscovered Gems with Potential for December 2025
feed.summary: As 2025 draws to a close amidst market turbulence, this article highlights small-cap stocks with strong fundamentals that present unique growth opportunities. It identifies a list of "Undiscovered Gems" in the U.S. and spotlights American Coastal Insurance (ACIC), Perdoceo Education (PRDO), and Graham (GHM) as favored picks due to their strategic moves, financial health, and undervaluation. The piece encourages investors to explore these lesser-known companies for potential long-term gains.

feed.title: Although American Coastal Insurance Corporation (NASDAQ:ACIC) insiders have sold lately, they have the highest ownership with 47% stake
feed.summary: Insiders at American Coastal Insurance Corporation (NASDAQ:ACIC) hold the largest ownership stake at 47%, despite recent sales. The company's largest shareholder is R. Peed with 29%, and institutional investors also hold a respectable portion. While there have been insider sales, the strong insider ownership suggests a vested interest in the company's growth.

feed.title: Special Dividend Announcement Boosts American Coastal Shares
feed.summary: American Coastal Corporation's shares advanced following investor presentations detailing its capital return strategy and the declaration of a special cash dividend of $0.75 per share. This move, coupled with proactive investor outreach, has been interpreted as a signal of financial strength, leading to a 3.35% gain for the insurer's stock. Investors are now looking for more concrete details on reinsurance and long-term capital deployment.

feed.title: American Coastal Insurance Corporation Declares Special Cash Dividend of $0.75 Per Share and Announces Executive Fireside Chat to Discuss “The Next Horizon”
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation announced a special cash dividend of $0.75 per share, payable on January 9, 2026, to shareholders of record on January 2, 2026. The company also disclosed plans for an executive fireside chat on January 14, 2026, to discuss its strategic initiatives, operational strategies, and financial outlook. Stakeholders can submit questions in advance for this event.

feed.title: American Coastal Insurance Corporation Declares Special Cash Dividend and Announces Upcoming Executive Fireside Chat
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation (ACIC) has declared a special cash dividend of $0.75 per share, payable on January 9, 2026, to shareholders of record by January 2, 2026. The company will also host an Executive Fireside Chat on January 14, 2026, at 11:00 AM ET to discuss its strategic initiatives, operational strategies, and financial outlook, inviting stakeholders to submit questions in advance. ACIC, which focuses on insuring condominium and homeowner association properties in Florida, highlights strong financial ratings from Demotech and Kroll.

feed.title: American Coastal (ACIC) Declares Special Cash Dividend
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corp (ACIC) has declared a special cash dividend of $0.75 per share, payable January 9, 2026, to shareholders of record on January 2, 2026. The company, operating in the financial services and insurance sector, exhibits strong financial health with a high Piotroski F-Score and robust free cash flow yield, coupled with an attractive valuation despite a recent decline in operating cash flow growth and insider selling. Potential investors should consider these risks alongside the company's compelling financial metrics.

feed.title: American Coastal Insurance Corporation Declares Special Cash Dividend of $0.75 Per Share and Announces Executive Fireside Chat to Discuss “The Next Horizon”
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation (ACIC) has declared a special cash dividend of $0.75 per share, payable on January 9, 2026, to shareholders of record on January 2, 2026. The company also announced an executive fireside chat on January 14, 2026, to discuss its strategic initiatives, operational strategies, and financial outlook, inviting stakeholders to submit questions in advance.

feed.title: Have Insiders Sold American Coastal Insurance Shares Recently?
feed.summary: Christopher Griffith, COO & Chief Information Officer of American Coastal Insurance Corporation (NASDAQ:ACIC), recently divested US$218k worth of shares, representing a 15% reduction in his holding. This follows a larger sale earlier in the year, totaling US$735k. While insiders bought 14.50k shares worth US$169k over the last year, they divested a total of 105.19k shares for US$1.2m, raising concerns despite high insider ownership.

feed.title: American Coastal Insurance Corporation Announces Participation in December Investor Conferences
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation (ACIC) announced its executive team will present at several investor conferences in December 2025, including the Wolfe Research Small and Mid-Cap Conference, Noble Capital Markets’ 21st Annual Emerging Growth Equity Conference, and Sidoti's Year End Virtual Investor Conference. CEO Bennet Bradford Martz and CFO Svetlana Castle will discuss strategic priorities and growth initiatives. The company, which insures condominium and HOA properties in Florida, holds strong financial ratings from Demotech and Kroll.

feed.title: Have Insiders Sold American Coastal Insurance Shares Recently?
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation's COO & Chief Information Officer, Christopher Griffith, recently sold US$218k worth of shares, reducing his holding by 15%. This follows a larger sale earlier in the year, totaling US$1.2m divested by insiders over the last 12 months, compared to US$169k in purchases. Despite high insider ownership (48%), the pattern of selling raises some concerns, although the company has not seen insider buying in the past three months.

feed.title: American Coastal Insurance Corp reports results for the quarter ended September 30 - Earnings Summary
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corp (ACIC) reported adjusted earnings of 61 cents per share for the quarter ended September 30, surpassing both the previous year's 54 cents and analyst expectations of 39 cents. Revenue for the quarter rose 8.5% to $80.82 million, also exceeding analyst predictions. The company's stock has seen a 5.9% rise this quarter, despite a 6.9% loss year-to-date, with analysts maintaining a "buy" rating and a median 12-month price target of $14.00, suggesting an 11.4% upside.

feed.title: American Coastal Insurance Corp (ACIC) Q3 2025 Earnings Call Highlights: Record Earnings and ...
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corp (ACIC) reported its best quarter to date in Q3 2025, with over $42 million in earnings before income taxes, a 10% increase in total revenues, and a 16% rise in net income year over year. The company successfully managed exposure during hurricane season and expanded its market reach with a new product for assisted and independent living facilities, while maintaining a strong liquidity position with $695 million in cash and investments. Despite these successes, the company faced challenges with increased policy acquisition costs, a softening commercial property market, and upcoming reinsurance renewal discussions.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: American Coastal’s Q3 2025 income rises 13.8% YoY
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation (AMCI) reported a strong Q3 2025, with net income from continuing operations increasing by 13.8% year-over-year to $80.2 million and revenues climbing 14.6%. The company's strategic initiatives, including a new insurance program for Florida's assisted living facilities, and disciplined underwriting contributed to a combined ratio improvement to 56.9%. AMCI anticipates a rebound in premiums for Q4 2025 and plans an investor day in January 2026 to update full-year guidance.

feed.title: American Coastal: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation (ACIC) reported third-quarter net income of $32.5 million, or 65 cents per share (adjusted 61 cents per share). The company, based in Saint Petersburg, Florida, posted revenue of $90.4 million for the period. Shares of American Coastal have dropped approximately 8% since the beginning of the year and over 3% in the last 12 months.

feed.title: Florida home insurance costs rose 1.5% so far in 2025. Will they ever get lower? - Orlando Sentinel
feed.summary: Florida home insurance premiums increased by 1.5% in the first eight months of 2025, which is an improvement over previous years but not the reduction many homeowners hoped for after reforms. Experts attribute potential future cost decreases to reinsurance costs, competition among carriers, rebuilding cost inflation, and the absence of major storms. While state officials highlight rate stability and new companies entering the market, others argue that actual savings for policyholders are yet to be seen, with South Florida experiencing the highest increases.

feed.title: American Coastal Insurance: Poor Growth Rates And Elevated P/B To Halt Rally (Technical Analysis)
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation (ACIC) maintains a 'Hold' rating due to technical and fundamental signals suggesting limited upside potential. Despite a strong Q2 earnings beat, the company faces negative growth rates, insider selling, and a cautious Q3 outlook from management. ACIC's valuation, with a trailing P/B of 1.95 and weak earnings growth, raises concerns for long-term investors, making share-price consolidation the most probable outcome.

feed.title: American Coastal, TypTap, Sutton National fined thousands by Florida’s Office of Insurance Regulation
feed.summary: The Florida Office of Insurance Regulation has fined American Coastal, TypTap, and Sutton National for various violations related to claims handling and unappointed adjusters. Total fines amount to $600,000, with American Coastal receiving the largest penalty. This indicates increased scrutiny on insurers in Florida, though some critics suggest the fines are insufficient.

feed.title: Earnings call transcript: American Coastal Insurance Q2 2025 shows strong growth
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation reported strong financial performance in Q2 2025, with a significant increase in net income and revenues, particularly in the Florida property insurance market. The company maintained a "GREAT" financial health rating and aims to resume growth in Q4 2025 through selective underwriting and expansion in the apartment insurance market, despite challenges like market saturation and regulatory changes. CEO Brad Martz highlighted a disciplined approach to risk and capital return, focusing on quality business over aggressive premium growth.

feed.title: American Coastal Insurance Corporation Schedules Q2 2025 Financial Results Release and Conference Call
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation (ACIC) announced that it will release its second-quarter financial results for 2025 on August 6, after market close, followed by a conference call at 5:00 p.m. ET. The company, which specializes in insuring condominium and homeowner association properties in Florida, holds strong financial stability ratings. The release provides details on accessing the conference call and webcast.

feed.title: KBRA upgrades American Coastal Insurance Corporation to investment grade
feed.summary: Kroll Bond Rating Agency (KBRA) has upgraded American Coastal Insurance Corporation's Issuer and Debt ratings from BB+ to BBB-, achieving investment grade status, and reaffirmed the A- Insurance Financial Strength Rating for AmCoastal. The outlook for all ratings has been revised from Stable to Positive, driven by improvements in financial structure, reduced leverage, and strong interest coverage ratios. This upgrade is expected to reduce the Company's annual interest expense by $1.5 million and support responsible business growth.

feed.title: American Coastal Insurance Corporation Announces a Five-Year Extension of Its Exclusive MGA Agreement With AmRisc and the Election of Two New Directors to Its Insurance Subsidiary
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation announced a five-year extension of its exclusive Managing Agency Contract with AmRisc, LLC, effective June 1, 2024. The company also announced the election of Cathy Swanson and Deirdre A. Brown, CPA, to the Board of Directors of American Coastal Insurance Company, reducing the board's size to five members. These appointments bring extensive experience in compliance, audit, finance, and investments to the board.

feed.title: American Coastal extends agreement with AmRisc
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation announced a five-year extension of its exclusive managing agency contract with AmRisc, effective June 1, 2024, and expiring January 1, 2029, pending regulatory approval. This agreement maintains exclusivity for the admitted condominium association property insurance market in Florida. In 2023, AmRisc generated approximately $635 million in written premiums for American Coastal.

feed.title: Patrick Maroney Increases Stake in American Coastal Insurance Co
feed.summary: Patrick Maroney, a Director at American Coastal Insurance Corp (ACIC), purchased 3,500 shares of the company on December 16, 2024, increasing his total ownership to 93,500 shares. This transaction follows a pattern of insider buys over the past year, with ACIC currently trading at $13.94, presenting a price-to-GF-Value ratio of 2.7, indicating it is significantly overvalued according to GuruFocus's intrinsic value estimate.

feed.title: American Coastal posts $28m net income in Q3’24, revenue climbs 56% to $82m
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation reported a significant increase in net income for Q3 2024, reaching $28.1 million compared to $10.6 million in Q3 2023. Total revenue climbed by 56.4% to $82.1 million, despite a slight decrease in gross written premium. The company also maintained a strong underwriting performance with a combined ratio of 57.7% and reduced its quota share reinsurance coverage.

feed.title: American Coastal estimates hurricane Milton losses well-below Armor cat bond trigger
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Company anticipates gross losses from Hurricane Milton to be between $150 million and $200 million, which is significantly below the $275 million trigger point for its Armor Re II Ltd. catastrophe bond. The insurer expects to make reinsurance recoveries but will retain full catastrophe reinsurance tower capacity, remaining profitable for the fourth quarter despite the hurricane's impact. Their retained losses from Hurricane Milton are estimated at $16.2 million net of tax impacts, with an additional $13 million in reinstatement premiums due to reinsurance recoveries.

feed.title: American Coastal announces five-year extension of MGA agreement with AmRisc
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corporation has announced a five-year extension of its exclusive Managing General Agency (MGA) agreement with AmRisc, LLC, effective June 1, 2024, and expiring January 1, 2029. This agreement pertains to the admitted condominium association property insurance market in Florida. Additionally, Cathy Swanson and Deirdre A. Brown, CPA, have been elected to AmCoastal’s Board of Directors, bringing extensive experience in finance, compliance, and auditing.

feed.title: AmCoastal boosts catastrophe bond with $1.2 billion reinsurance tower
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance (AmCoastal) has expanded its catastrophe reinsurance tower to approximately $1.2 billion for 2024, supported by a new $200 million Armor Re II Ltd. Florida named storm cat bond. The company aims for increased overall protection, improved cost efficiency, and similar retention levels for the upcoming hurricane season, with plans to purchase an additional $265 million in private market coverage. AmCoastal also reduced its quota share reinsurance from 40% to 20%, expecting an increase in net premiums earned.

feed.title: American Coastal to sell insurance subsidiary to Forza Insurance
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance has agreed to sell its subsidiary, Interboro Insurance, to Forza Insurance Holdings. This move marks American Coastal's exit from personal lines insurance, allowing it to focus on its commercial specialty property portfolio. The acquisition is expected to diversify Forza's property insurance portfolio and leverage partnerships with independent MGA SageSure for Interboro's operations.

feed.title: American Coastal, Once Affiliated with UPC, Has Buyer for Interboro in New York
feed.summary: American Coastal Insurance Corp. announced a cash buyer for its New York-based Interboro Insurance Co. The sale, expected to close in about five months, will be for the book value of Interboro, currently around $23 million, but anticipated to grow. This divestiture aligns with American Coastal's strategy to exit personal lines and focus on specialty commercial property/casualty.

feed.title: At a glance: Hurricane research at FIU
feed.summary: Florida International University (FIU) is at the forefront of hurricane research, addressing the increasing intensity of storms and growing coastal populations. FIU's efforts include operating the Florida Public Hurricane Loss Model, developing advanced prediction and mitigation techniques, and housing key facilities like the Wall of Wind and the upcoming NICHE lab. These initiatives are supported by significant funding and involve collaborations with multiple universities to enhance resilience against extreme weather events.

feed.title: After UPC Insolvency, Parent Company Rebrands to American Coastal Insurance
feed.summary: Following the insolvency of United Property & Casualty Insurance Co., its parent company, United Insurance Holdings, has rebranded to American Coastal Insurance Corp. The company will trade on NASDAQ as "ACIC" starting August 15 and is focusing on its strong position in Florida's commercial residential condominium association market. This move follows a period of significant financial transformation and the exit of UPC from several state markets.

feed.title: United Insurance Holdings Corp. (UIHC) Announces Name and Ticker Change to American Coastal Insurance Corporation (ACIC)
feed.summary: United Insurance Holdings Corp. (UIHC) announced its rebranding to American Coastal Insurance Corporation (ACIC), effective prior to market open on August 15, 2023. This change reflects an increased focus on AmCoastal's commercial residential business and its leading market share in Florida condominium associations. The company also scheduled its Second Quarter 2023 financial results release and conference call for August 10, 2023.

feed.title: United Insurance Holdings Corp. Announces the Sale of Its Florida Personal Lines Renewal Rights to Slide Insurance, Inc.
feed.summary: United Insurance Holdings Corp. (UPC Insurance) announced the sale of renewal rights for its Florida personal lines business to Slide Insurance, Inc. This transaction will accelerate the run-off of UPC Insurance’s personal lines portfolio, reducing its exposure to Florida liabilities and allowing it to focus on its commercial specialty property portfolio. UPC Insurance will cancel approximately 72,000 Florida personal lines policies on February 1, 2023, with Slide immediately issuing replacement policies.

feed.title: Insurance surge slams AMI condos
feed.summary: A Bradenton Beach condominium complex, Runaway Bay, experienced a 337% annual increase in property insurance costs due to stricter underwriting guidelines, especially concerning older roofs and barrier island locations. This surge, attributed to a hardening market and past fraudulent claims, is leading to a 42% increase in resident assessments and is a concern for other island complexes. Condo insurance agents are suggesting lobbying state legislators to relax Citizens Property Insurance Corp. guidelines to address the issue.

feed.title: Former Coastal American president launches homeowners carrier
feed.summary: Ned Dolese, former president of Coastal American and executive at HCI Group, has launched a new Mississippi-based homeowners insurer named Property Insurance Company of America (PICA). The launch was facilitated with assistance from Stonybrook Capital.

feed.title: AmRisc targets further growth with Transverse and GeoVera capacity
feed.summary: Cat-focused MGA AmRisc grew E&S gross written premium (GWP) by 20 percent to $1.2bn last year and is looking to further expand in 2021 supported by new capacity from Transverse and GeoVera. The MGA also improved its attritional loss ratios significantly and increased its overall capacity by 10 percent, or $300mn. AmRisc's CEO Brian Reid expects continued pricing momentum and emphasizes the importance of portfolio management in retaining and gaining new carrier partnerships.
